discussion.content: C is correct. The reason is that s3:GetObjectAcl should be pointing to a resource like arn:aws:s3:::cloudacademy/*, but it is actually pointing arn:aws:s3:::cloudacademy.
C. It will give an error as no object is defined as part of the policy while the action defines the rule about the object
For point 2: To use this operation, you must have READ_ACP access to the object

choices.A: It will make the cloudacademy bucket as well as all its objects as public
choices.D: It will make the cloudacademy bucket as public
choices.C: It will give an error as no object is defined as part of the policy while the action defines the rule about the object
choices.B: It will allow everyone to view the ACL of the bucket

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
user can change the availability zone of the EC2 instance. Note that the instance needs to be stopped before changing the availability zone.
B. Create an AMI of the running instance and launch the instance in a separate AZ

questions.question_text: A user has launched two EBS backed EC2 instances in the US-East-1a region. The user wants to change the zone of one of the instances. How can the user change it?

choices.D: From the AWS EC2 console, select the Actions - > Change zones and specify the new zone
choices.A: The zone can only be modified using the AWS CLI
choices.C: Stop one of the instances and change the availability zone
choices.B: Create an AMI of the running instance and launch the instance in a separate AZ

questions.answer_description: With AWS EC2, when a user is launching an instance he can select the availability zone (AZ) at the time of launch. If the zone is not selected, AWS selects it on behalf of the user. Once the instance is launched, the user cannot change the zone of that instance unless he creates an AMI of that instance and launches a new instance from it.

AWS Identity and Access Management is a web service which allows organizations to manage users and user permissions for various AWS services. If the organization (account ID 123412341234) wants their users to manage their subscription to the groups, they should create a relevant policy for that. The below mentioned policy allows the respective IAM user to update the membership of the group called MarketingGroup.
questions.question_text:
An organization (account ID 123412341234) has configured the IAM policy to allow the user to modify his credentials. What will the below mentioned statement allow the user to perform?
//IMG//

choices.B: The IAM policy will allow the user to subscribe to any IAM group
choices.A: The IAM policy will throw an error due to an invalid resource name
choices.D: Allow the IAM user to delete the TestingGroup
choices.C: Allow the IAM user to update the membership of the group called TestingGroup

discussion.content: C. Allow the IAM user to update the membership of the group called TestingGroup

questions.question_text: A user has configured ELB with two EBS backed instances. The user has stopped the instances for 1 week to save costs. The user restarts the instances after 1 week. Which of the below mentioned statements will help the user to understand the ELB and instance registration better?

choices.C: If the instances have the same Elastic IP assigned after reboot they will be registered with ELB
choices.D: The instances will automatically get registered with ELB
choices.B: The user cannot stop the instances if they are registered with ELB
choices.A: There is no way to register the stopped instances with ELB

discussion.content: D. Should Automatically get registered as it would have been part of a Target Group
D. The instances will automatically get registered with ELB

comments.content: If you connect to your instance using SSH and get any of the following errors, Host key not found in [directory], Permission denied (publickey), Authentication failed, permission denied, or Connection closed by [instance] port 22, verify that you are connecting with the appropriate user name for your AMI and that you have specified the proper private key (.pem) file for your instance.

discussion.content:
it is A

Error: Permission denied or connection closed by [instance] port 22
If you connect to your instance using SSH and get any of the following errors, Host key not found in [directory], Permission denied (publickey), Authentication failed, permission denied, or Connection closed by [instance] port 22, verify that you are connecting with the appropriate user name for your AMI and that you have specified the proper private key (.pem) file for your instance.

The appropriate user names are as follows:

For Amazon Linux 2 or the Amazon Linux AMI, the user name is ec2-user.
A. The user has provided the wrong user name for the OS login

questions.question_text: A user is trying to connect to a running EC2 instance using SSH. However, the user gets a Host key not found error. Which of the below mentioned options is a possible reason for rejection?
questions.answer_description:
If the user is trying to connect to a Linux EC2 instance and receives the Host Key not found error the probable reasons are:
The private key pair is not right
The user name to login is wrong

choices.A: The user has provided the wrong user name for the OS login
choices.D: The access key to connect to the instance is wrong
choices.C: The security group is not configured properly
choices.B: The instance CPU is heavily loaded
